posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.86.0-beta.1. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • We can‚Äôt fix the awkward silence that follows, but we fixed a bug that sometimes caused the raised hand indicator to remain visible (with a count of zero) if someone raised and lowered their hand really quickly.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.85.0-beta.1‚Ä¶v7.86.0-beta.1 ¬∑ signalapp/Signal-Desktop ¬∑ GitHub

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.85 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.86.0-beta.1

53 new commits since 7.85.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.86.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Fix sticker creator [2]

  • Trigger apt-get update if install fails on CI [3]

  • 1:1 calls: Show blurred avatar instead of black bars [4]

  • Update Prettier [5]

  • CallScreen: Fix 1:1 display where container aspect ratio exceeds video [6]

  • When checking files, handle trailing whitespace [7]

  • Init remote megaphone UI [8]

  • Fix redux memo dev warning in getModeSpecificProps [9]

  • Fix foreign key error pinning in-memory messages [10]

  • Remove calling dev tools [11]

  • Prepare for upgrade to React 19 [12]

  • Fix pinned messages state syncing [13]

  • Skip conversation save when applying MRR from storage service [14]

  • Resize calling video containers on video aspect ratio changes [15]

  • Improved logging: sync messages and outgoing sends [16]

  • Ensure setLocalPreviewContainer is called when video is enabled [17]

  • resolveUsernameByLink: Move to libsignal typed API [18]

  • Polls: Longer question length and 1:1 Receive Support [19]

  • Add z-index to AxoBaseDialog to fix Call Quality Survey placement [20]

  • Fix logging of handleAttachmentsProcessing error [21]

  • Rework conversation panel layout and sub-header styles [22]

  • Ensure composition input is focused when clicking to edit or reply to message [23]

  • Update twitter -> X in sticker creator share sheet [24]

  • Add timeouts for TUS uploads [25]

  • Contacts in documents tab of Media Gallery [26]

  • Clear thumbnail/screenshot when forwarding media [27]

  • Fix crash report stack traces [28]

  • Remove outline/highlight shadow from chat header [29]

  • Add view-once media support for pinned messages bar [30]

  • Update release notes [31]

  • Update strings [32]

  • Update DNS fallback [33]

  • CallScreen: On ringing screen, remove Avatar in center of screen [34]

  • View-once media: backend send support [35]

  • Improve focus management for AxoContextMenu [36]

  • Exclude mentionAciBinary in processedRange [37]

  • Fix focus state when forwarding [38]

  • Update Electron to v39.2.7 [39]

  • Add option to sort by file size in Media Gallery [40]

  • Add backup support for pinned messages [41]

  • Add expiration timer to pinned message notification [42]

  • Pinned messages UI fixes [43]

  • Make date-rendering consistent: show year if older than six months [44]

  • Reintroduce black bars around 1:1 remote video [45]

  • Fix raised hand count showing 0 [46]

  • Add expire timers to pin/unpin data messages [47]

  • Sync and update UI when pinned messages expire [48]

  • Mark window inactive immediately when blurred [49]

  • Update context menu strings for pin/unpin [50]

  • Release notes for 7.86 [51]

  • Update strings [52]

  • 7.86.0-beta.1 [53]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.85.0-beta.1‚Ä¶v7.86.0-beta.1

link_counts.title: Pin a message to top of chat

posts.cooked:
1. watch last message‚Äôs details (right click ‚Äì Info).
  2. Go back to the chat window by back arrow

Result: You won‚Äôt be at the bottom of the message list but it jumps up by a few (5-6?) messages.

It‚Äôs easily reproducable, so I don‚Äôt think debug log is needed.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.88 release

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
This has been around for a bit since implementing Folders.

  1. Add Unread as a folder
  2. Have any other folder selected
  3. Receive a new message
  4. Click the new message in the Unread folder

This marks it read, but the conversation doesn‚Äôt disappear from the Unread folder. It doesn‚Äôt disappear until you choose another folder. Honestly a very minor UI/UX thing. But this is what I‚Äôd expect:

  1. Have Unread as a folder
  2. Receive a new message
  3. Click the Unread folder
  4. Click the conversation with the unread message
  5. The message is marked read
  6. The UI intelligently finds the next relevant folder with the same conversation in it so it becomes the selected conversation.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.86.0-beta.1/f20e7b3541bf5433fb8e99b6a0a078779dbcddf3b274e613787912bff549577a.gz

And just a note for everyone that follows these threads that tomorrow (Monday 19 Jan) is a U.S. holiday, so there might not be any development activity.

Thanks for the detailed report. This was an alternate UX path which we considered, so it‚Äôs currently working as designed. It‚Äôs still helpful to get feedback on the feature. Sorry if it‚Äôs different than what you expect!

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
Hi all, I discovered, that when you click on a picture that is in full screen (to zoom in) you need to move the courser after clicking, otherwise the zooming does not take place. This feels odd to me. I recommend zooming in as soon as you click on a specific area.
My debug log: https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.85.0/80007f442bf3be55f73a0568bbcac6a4b2d9ba3f094645e9ddcbe3fb31670c91.gz

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
And I just discovered:

That in some people‚Äôs "About‚Äù

image884√ó458 44.4 KB

The name I gave the contact appears in all the blacked out positions.
I have not discovered a pattern yet. For some contacts it‚Äôs correct, for some it isn‚Äôt.

I found this because my dad definitely does not name himself ‚ÄúDad‚Äù on Signal .

paulschoen:

The name I gave the contact appears in all the blacked out positions.
I have not discovered a pattern yet. For some contacts it‚Äôs correct, for some it isn‚Äôt.

I found this because my dad definitely does not name himself ‚ÄúDad‚Äù on Signal .

That must be the nickname you set for those contacts! In brackets is the name that contact set for themself when they set up Signal on their phone. If there‚Äôs no name in brackets it means the name they set during registration is the same as how you have it saved in your contacts app.

Aku-Stable:

That must be the nickname you set for those contacts!

From the recent (40 minutes ago) beta update on iOS:

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.92 release

When displaying a contact name, also display the profile name [4]

Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.87 release

posts.cooked:
Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.87 release.
